content.question: If F and f are differentiable functions such that <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>F</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@48F3@</annotation> </semantics> </math> , and if <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>F</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F24@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>F</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>b</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F25@</annotation> </semantics> </math> where a<b, which of the following must be true?

choices.label: f(x)=0 for some x such that a<x<b.
f(x)>0 for all x such that a<x<b.
f(x)<0 for all x such that a<x<b.

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>F</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EFB@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for all x such that a<x<b.

content.answer: f(x)=0 for some x such that a<x<b.

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
